Container.Name: LifeIsFeudal-YourOwn
Container.Overview:
This Docker will download and install SteamCMD. It will also install Life is Feudal: Your Own and run it.
Initial server configuration: **Servername:** LiF Docker **Password:** Docker **Admin Password:** adminDocker
**ATTENTION:** First startup can take very long since it downloads the gameserver files and it also installs the runtimes which can take quite some time!
Update Notice: Simply restart the container if a newer version of the game is available.
Container.DonateText: If you like my work please

Config.Name: GAME_ID
Config.Description: The GAME_ID that the container downloads at startup. If you want to install a static or beta version of the game change the value to: '320850 -beta YOURBRANCH' (without quotes, replace YOURBRANCH with the branch or version you want to install).

Config.Name: Validate Installation
Config.Description: Set the Variable to 'true' if you want to validate the installation otherwise leave it blank.

Config.Name: TCP - Game Ports
Config.Description: TCP Game Ports (If you need another port delete this entry and create a new TCP port mapping here in the template with the Container and Host port+2 set to the same as in your configuration).

Config.Name: UDP - Game Ports
Config.Description: UDP Game Ports (If you need another port delete this entry and create a new UDP port mapping here in the template with the Container and Host port+2 set to the same as in your configuration).

Config.Name: Steam-Username
Config.Description: Your Steam username goes here if you want to install a game that needs a valid account, otherwise leave it blank (ATTENTION: You have to disable Steam Guard).

Config.Name: Steam-Password
Config.Description: Your Steam password goes here if you want to install a game that needs a valid account, otherwise leave it blank (ATTENTION: You have to disable Steam Guard).
